newsitem.title: JAPAN: Moody's cuts NCB bond rating to Ba1.
newsitem.headline: Moody's cuts NCB bond rating to Ba1.

text.p: Moody's Investors Service said on Friday it had cut its rating for Nippon Credit Bank Ltd bonds to Ba1 from Baa3.
The downgrade of senior debt rating concludes a review started on February 18, Moody's said in a statement.
The bank's Baa3/Prime-3 deposit ratings were not under review, although the outlook for the deposit ratings remains negative, Moody's said.
It is the first time that Moody's has given a Ba1 senior debt rating to a Japanese bank, a Moody's official said.
As indicated in the bank's E financial strength rating, Moody's expects that NCB may ultimately require outside assistance, Moody's said in the statement.
Bonds which are rated Ba are judged to have speculative elements and their future cannot be considered well-assured, Moody's said.
Moody's said that NCB's portfolio contained substantial unrealised losses and its problem assets represented a significant burden on its weak capitalisation and its mediocre earnings outlook.

Moody's said there remains a degree of ambiguity surrounding public policy support for bank debenture holders, that in Moody's opinion warrants a distinction between deposit and senior debt -- for example, domestic debenture -- ratings.
